document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Dinarte, Cunha, Uemerson Silva Da, Bampi, Paula Maria, Moraes, Gilberto José De & Ferla, Noeli Juarez
document.docTitle: Typhlodromips salvadorii Goncalves & Ferla, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Araucaria Forest of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, with new records and descriptions of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Araucaria Forest of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, with new records and descriptions of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . This new species belongs the bladderae species group (
Chant & McMurtry, 2005 b
), characterised by having the major duct of the spermatheca swollen, bladder-like.
Typhlodromips corycus (
Schuster 1966
)
differs from this new species by having
Z 5
only about 1.1 times as long as
Z 4
, both smooth. It also differs from
Typhlodromips pallinii
Gonçalves et al. 2013
by having setae
j 3
,
s 4
, Sg IV, Sti IV, St IV and St IV longer and the calyx of the spermatheca also longer.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–23 .
Typhlodromips salvadorii
n. sp.
Female: 19. Dorsal shield, 20. Ventral surface, 21. Chelicera, 22. Spermatheca. 23. Leg IV.

Chelicera (

25

20

Spermatheca (
Fig. 23
). Major duct swollen and bladder-like
15
14 ( 13–15 ).

Type material.
Holotype female from
Myrcia retorta Cambess.
( Myrtaceae ) São Francisco de Paula, State of Rio Grande do Sul,
July 2013
, Gonçalves D. coll. Two females paratypes from
Myrcianthes pungens O. Berg.
(Yrtaceae), in same place in,
October 2013
, are deposited at Museu de Ciências Naturais (ZAUMCN), UNIVATES—Centro Universitário, Lajeado, Rio Grande do Sul State, Brazil . Also collected on
Trema micrantha
L. ( Ulmaceae ) and
Pouteria salicifolia
( Sapotaceae ) in the same place, in
July 2013
.
Etymology. This species is named after Dr. José Roberto Salvadori , an eminent Brazilian entomologist.
